Dear Dr [Last name], 
 
Thank you for reaching out about merging your accounts registered on [Journal Name]. 
 
I have reviewed your accounts, and I have noticed that both accounts were assigned as reviewers for the same manuscript. I can also see that you have completed the review assignment on both accounts. 
 
In this regard, our system is currently unable to merge accounts. This is due to a technical limitation that prevents merging accounts when they have completed the same review assignment. 
 
To resolve this issue, I've escalated this to our Technical team and rest assured that I will keep you updated on the progress of this resolution. 
 
In the meantime, you can continue to access your information and manage your reviewer responsibilities through both accounts. 
 
I apologize for any inconvenience this may cause and appreciate your patience as we work towards a solution.

Dear Dr [Last Name], 
 
 
Thank you for your email regarding your interest to recommend potential reviewers. 
 
Allow me to let you know that, in line with our commitment to ensure the integrity of the research we publish and to build trust in science, we no longer accept author-suggested reviewers for our journals. 
 
Please rest assured that our editors are well-supported with tools and guidance to identify and select the most appropriate candidates to review your manuscript. 
 
If you require any further support, please let me know or you may contact us via Live Chat here https://service.elsevier.com/app/home/supporthub/publishing/
